section: THIS JOINT VENTURE AGREEMENT (the "Agreement") made and entered into this 20th day of Friday, March 2020 (the "Execution Date"), BETWEEN: BorrowMoney.com, inc of 512 Bayshore DR, suite 201 Fort Lauderdale FL 33304, and JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go of 4060 Johns Creek Parkway Suite H Suwanee, GA 30024 (individually the "Member" and collectively the "Members").
explanation: The agreement states the execution date is "Friday, March 2020". March 20, 2020 was a Friday. But, the agreement is made and entered into 'this 20th day of Friday, March 2020', which is structurally flawed. Friday is not a day, it is part of the actual date and should be removed. This makes the sentence awkwardly worded and presents a structural flaw that does not make sense.

section: The exclusive purpose of the Venture (the "Purpose") will be IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service.
explanation: The sentence structure for this purpose clause is weak and structurally flawed. The use of mixed capitalization ('IT Development. internet Back office Maintenance And Deployment of medical Service.') and lack of clear grammatical structure makes the purpose vague and open to multiple interpretations. It's unclear if "internet" modifies all subsequent terms, or if they are separate purposes. The statement is poorly structured.

section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The section describing JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go's duties lacks clarity and contains structural issues.  The phrase "Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions" is confusing and poorly worded. It's unclear *when* this 10% payment is due (is it ongoing, or a one-time payment related to the initial $60,000?), and how it relates to the "Total Contributions". The wording is misaligned and poorly structured.

section: BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The capital contribution from BorrowMoney.com, Inc. is problematic. Assigning a $3,500,000.00 value to leased office space is highly suspect and lacks a clear, objective basis. Leased space does not translate to owned assets and should be specified properly. A specific description of what is supposed to be done must be included so the court knows what is to be done to make the contract enforceable.

section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: There are multiple structural flaws here, especially within the way the sections have been structured in conjunction with legal terms. The capital contributions for JVLS, LLC are inconsistent and questionable. It lists '$60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD'. The way the text is organized it implies that $3,500,000 is also a contribution of JVLS, LLC. This is not clear and should be amended to make sure the correct amount is specified.

section: Valuation of Interest 39. In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: Using only the revenue of the previous three months to value a business is an extremely flawed methodology. It fails to account for profitability, assets, liabilities, future prospects, or any established business valuation principles. The short-term revenue could be easily manipulated or skewed by temporary factors. This is structually flawed.
